thread.title: Watch Migos' Surreal 'Bad and Boujee' Performance on 'Ellen'
thread.title_full: Watch Migos' Surreal 'Bad and Boujee' Performance on 'Ellen'

title: Watch Migos' Surreal 'Bad and Boujee' Performance on 'Ellen'
text:
Watch Migos' Surreal 'Bad and Boujee' Performance on 'Ellen' Atlanta hip-hop trio play 'Culture' hit, co-star in all-star reading PSA Atlanta hip-hip group Migos dropped by 'Ellen' Monday for a surreal performance of their chart-topping 'Culture' single "Bad & Boujee." 
Atlanta hip-hip group Migos dropped by Ellen Monday for a surreal performance of their chart-topping Culture single "Bad & Boujee." Related Migos' Wild World: One Night in the Studio With 'Bad and Boujee' Trio Syrup, $300,000 cars and "magicianal" rhymes: Up close with Atlanta rappers fans think are better than the Beatles 
"The rap trio behind the Dab dance craze hit the stage for a performance of their #1 hit song," the show wrote of the visit on YouTube. ("Bad and Boujee" was actually dethroned from Number One on the Billboard 100 by Ellen DeGeneres' guest last week , Ed Sheeran.) 
In a recent Rolling Stone interview, the trio talked about the surprise mainstream success of "Bad and Boujee," a song that touches on groupies and "cooking up dope with an Uzi." 
"We did it the trap way, not the pop way," Offset said of the hit. Takeoff added, "That's what got us here." 
In addition to the "Bad and Boujee" performance, on an episode last week, Migos took part in an Ellen -made PSA encouraging kids to read, with Big Sean, Lin-Manuel Miranda, Ice Cube and Ty Dolla $ign also appearing. 
Following the episode, DeGeneres posed backstage with Migos and stacks of money: A post shared by Ellen (@theellenshow) on Feb 20, 2017 at 11:46am PST More News
